resources.string:
Swiss Army Knife for Galaxy S. 
by Yonghwan SO 
	scinix@gmail.com 
 
	http://sio4.tistory.com 
	http://twitter.com/scinix

Features: 
* Application Manager 
 - remove some unused system apps with it. 
* System Tweak 
* Reverse Tethering 
 - reverse tethering via WiFi/USB tethering. 
 - device can access to Internet via PC's network.

Changelogs: 
* version 0.3 (2010-12-22) 
 - Add About tab. and... return to home from hospital. 
* version 0.1 (2010-12-10) 
 - Implement Reverse Tethering feature. 
 - Issue #1: Market and GTalk are not working.

Connect internet via Reverse WiFi/USB Tethering. With this, your mobile device can share your PC\'s (wired) network and access to internet via Wireless LAN or USB cable. \nIs it MOBILE? anyway I need it.

Usage: 
	0. enable WiFi/USB tether of your device. 
	1. enter IP address of WiFi/USB interface of PC. 
	 (Dynamic by default.) 
	2. enter DNS address. 
	 (default is last DNS using by device.) 

on PC side: 
	1. connect to device's WiFi/USB tether. (Dynamic) 
	2. enable internet share. 
	 (on linux, enable IP Forward and Masquerade.) 
	 $ echo 1 |sudo tee /proc/sys/net/ipv4/ip_forward 
	 $ sudo iptables -t nat -A POSTROUTING -o eth0 -j MASQUERADE 

Known Problems: 
	* cannot connect to gtalk service. 
	* cannot download apps from market. 
	 (but market searching is working.) 
	* can i determind peer address automatically?
